reviewText: Oh yeah. MMPR on DVD! I have the two feature films (the other beiing the Turbo movie) already. But my wish of the shows being on DVD has finally been granted. I'm gonna hold out for the seasons 1-7 set cause that way, I'll have everything at once with 3 Bonus discs full of awesome features!Please support Shout Factory so other shows like Beetleborgs, VR Troopers, Mystic Knights, etc releases will follow.My favorite Power Rangers era is the original six with Tommy as Green Ranger and the serious Zedd (he later became comedic and silly). All the Zords have their place in history as I liked them all really. They all had their unique special stuff that helped the Rangers, Zordon and Alpha 5 were the best.RIP Thuy Trang (Trini) - hope she is spoken of somewhere in the set though an actual tribute to her would be best.

reviewText: Ok, if you don't want to be bombarded with 90s nostalgia, skip this review right now.  But if you care to take a trip down memory lane for a minute or two, then read on by all means.  One more thing: this review is written from the perspective of a totally blind viewer.  Thus, I won't be discussing picture quality or anything of that sort.  Naturally, that type of stuff bores me to tears. Read about it in someone else's review if you dig it.  Anyway, onward!As a kid of the early to mid 90s, this show meant so much to me.  I started watching it during the summer of 1994, a few months before Lord Zedd made his monsterous debut.  So I guess I came into the series somewhat later than some of you guys.  But as a bright eyed kid of 10, the show blew me away and I remember waking up every morning that summer around 7 a.m. just to watch megazord kick some monster butt.  I was hooked.My saint of a mom bought me all the zord systems up til Zeo when I stopped collecting.  I taped as many episodes as I could via Fox Kids weekday afternoons because I loved collecting the show.I suppose I was one of a small number of blind guys who watched the show, and have my little bro to thank for introducing me to the series as well as helping me get a feel for transforming and combining each zord system.  Ah, the fun the two of us had each summer when I'd visit him in Memphis, playing with those freakin toys and watching the myriad of taped episodes.  So it's about time Shout released this series.  I gave all my PR toys away many years ago to the poor.  But just having this series on DVD all the way up to Power Rangers in Space will be enough for me.TVshowsondvd.com states that we'll be getting the first 30 episodes on 3 disks in vol 1 comprising the first half of season 1.  They are as follows.1.  Day of The Dumpster2.  High Five3.  Teamwork4.  A Pressing Engagement5.  Different Drum6.  Food Fight7.  Big Sisters8.  Switching Places9.  I, Eye Guy(Jeez his action figure was ugly!)10.  Foul Play in the Sky11.  For Whom The Bell Trolls12.  Happy Birthday, Zack(Always wanted a Nasty Knight fig but never found him!)13.  No Clowning Around14.  Power Ranger Punks (First saw this one during Pink Ranger week in 95.  Anyone remember Fox doing this?)15.  Peace, Love and Woe16.  Dark Warrior17.  Green With evil part I: Out of Control18.  Green with Evil Part II: Jason's Battle19.  Green With Evil part III: The Rescue20.  Green With Evil Part IV:  Eclipsing Megazord21.  Green With Evil Part V: Breaking The Spell (in my opinion, best 5 episodes from season 1)22.  The Trouble With Shellshock23.  Itsy Bitsy Spider24.  The Spit Flower (the one where Kim's float for the parade got trashed!  Made my little sister cry too.)25.  Life's a Masquerade26.  Gung Ho! (Titanus is introduced, and by Zordon's giant floating head, it took me forever to find that toy!  I keep seeing my poor mom braving the crowds on Black Friday in 94, haha!  But us kids just have to have the ultrazord, didn't we?)27.  Wheel of Misfortune28.  Island of Illusion part I29.  Island of Illusion part II30.  The RockstarThis DVD release certainly is a sight for sore eyes.  So to all those who still hold this gem of a series close to your hearts, may the power protect you.  Can't wait for season 2 and beyond.Update as of June 27th, 2012...I'm sure most readers of this review have already heard the news from Timelife, but for those who have been crazy busy over the past month, timelife is offering seasons 1-7 in a boxset for $219.  I've already preordered mine as of a month ago.  It's a pretty sweet deal, ladies and gents.  Mighty Morphin through Lost Galaxy.  So if you have the cash, go for it.  I'm sure Shout! Factory will release these sets one right after the other so if you're a bit strapped for cash, these 3 to 4 dvdhalf season sets might be the way to go.  It's completely up to you.  And if you're going to Comic Con this year, they're also offering a 19 dvd set of Mighty Morphin Power Rangers: Seasons 1-3.  And I'm sure that includes the Alien Rangers Miniseries.  So if you're heading there, nab one and support Shout! Factory.  Maybe I'll get to go one of these years.Update as of 8-13-12  Got my seasons 1-7 boxset in the mail from Timelife today!  The quality is terrific, and the bonus features are great as expected from Shout! Factory.  My only problem with this set is that no Today on Power Rangers segments were included with Mighty Morphin season 1 part 1, etc.  No big deal, I suppose, but I'm a completest.  All the recaps and next time ons were included for Turbo, Space, and Lost Galaxy though.  Not sure why this bugs me a bit.  Shout! is known for giving viewers the option of watching episodes with or without recaps on their Transformers G1 and G.I. Joe DVDs, and I'm thinking the MMPR today on segments still exist, so why no love for the opening teasers of the earlier seasons?  All in all, a great series and it's a thrill to own every episode.
summary: At last! Thank you Shout Factory!

reviewText: I was so excited about this release, but when finally sitting down and watching it, it was like viewing a bad rip-off version.The quality of the picture was VHS looking, and it was badly interlaced and compressed, which caused digitally lines whenever there was movement, and a washy effect to boot. I was hoping this would've been a completely remastered release but I guess they're saving that for the blu-ray release perhaps?The sound was okay, and the stock footage from the Japanese version wasn't as high quality as the originally filmed stuff, but this DVD is not for people with a TV 50-inch and bigger because you can just see all the imperfections in the production of these discs.

reviewText: "Mighty Morphin Power Rangers" fans can celebrate now that volume one of the first season of the television show is available on DVD. It's not high definition Blu-ray but it's the next best thing. Thirty of the sixty episodes are included in this three-disc collection from Saban and Shout! Factory.In "Mighty Morphin Power Rangers - Season 1: Volume 1," astronauts on a mission to the Moon release an evil sorceress named Rita Repulsa and her monstrous followers from 10,000 years of imprisonment. Upon her escape, she decides to conquer the Earth. Her nemesis, Zordon, recruits five teenagers and gives them super powers to defend their planet from Rita's forces. They are assisted by a robot sidekick named Alpha 5 and giant robotic vehicles called Zords that look like dinosaurs.Kids of all ages will love the martial arts combat and monster mayhem served up in this classic television show from the early 1990s. Rita's minions look as scary as they can dressed up in rubber suits with mouths that don't move. The action sequences and physical battles between the Rangers and their enemies are harmless and energetic, encouraging kids to get active. My son can barely sit still after one episode. He's constantly up running about and kicking like a ninja.The only thing that might cause kids to scratch their heads in bewilderment are the awful -looking and dated clothing worn by the Rangers outside of their costumes. They make me wish someone could digitally remove clothing and put something a little more current on each character.Everyone wants to know if the 30 episodes in this collection include the ones with the first appearance of the Green Ranger. I'm happy to report it does. He shows up around half-way through this first volume.The picture quality is better than VHS. However, don't hold your breath for a hi- def transfer. It looks like Shout! Factory took the original source material and did a straight conversion over to DVD with very little image clean-up.Consumers and fans will be upset with the fact that there are no extra features included in the release. I'm surprised they couldn't get a few of the original Rangers together to do a commentary track. What else are they doing these days? Didn't anyone shoot footage of the making of this show? If they did, you won't see it here.Enthusiasts will be content with "Mighty Morphin Power Rangers - Season 1: Volume 1." A lack of bonus material will no doubt spoil the mood. The three-disc set is still recommended for the hardcore devotees of the series who waited so long to get these on DVD.
summary: DVD Review: "Mighty Morphin Power Rangers - Season 1: Volume 1"

reviewText: Mighty Morphin Power Rangers is awesome.  It was basically my childhood--I was 6 when I saw the very first episode on TV.  Seeing the show make its debut on Netflix last year gave me agreat amount of hope for a DVD release in great quality.However, upon picking up my Volume 1 DVD today I found myself disappointed with the quality of the image... on a high-def display anyway.  On my 40" LCD the image comes in as choppy or blurry at times.  In its defense, I can accept that older programs won't look as good on a newer TV.  I wasn't expecting it to look like a blu-ray or anything, but I thought it would look slightly better than this.That's just my opinion, anyway.  At the end of the day, I'm just glad I have some of the original Power Rangers episodes on DVD finally.  This is an amazing value for anyone who grew up with the series like I did.  Just don't expect it to look amazing on your HDTV.
summary: It's Morphin Time!  I wish the quality was better though.

reviewText: I was amazed that the Green Ranger showed up so soon in the series, Iconic as ever, the original Mighty Morphin is just uncompilable. Even if you prefer a different series of Power Rangers, nothing quite beats the Japanese stock footage the earlier seasons cut in with the American actors. The main character who I had forgot about from my childhood, was Scorpina. A Evil but Cute Henchman for Rita Repulsa, who were both cut from the original Japanese footage, giving them completely wrong mouth movement. But for the MMPR's style, it is more a pro than a con. However, Saban did not have access to much of the props and costumes right away, so you'll not be seeing helmets off power rangers, or many scenes with the Unmorphed Teens and Goldar in the same shot. I initially thought this was some of the worst editing I had ever seen, being a freelance editor myself. But after learning about the Japanese stock footage, the editing starts becoming 'magical'.

reviewText: this will be short and to the point.this set will have the first 30 episodes on dvd for the first time here in the U.S. ! these individual sets will contain closed captioning, but no subtitles. There will also be no special features for these sets. The "today on" will not be on the sets, because shout factory wanted as much room on the dvd for episodes as possible. we are getting great quality episodes, as good as they can be for a 90's show, for a low price!now for those who LOVE special features like myself, if you want a 3-disc dvd special features set, go to timelife's website and order the 7 year boxset! it incudles 338 episodes from mighty morphin to lost galaxy! the complete "zordon era" as the fans call it. on timelife's website you will see box art, episode listings, and some sneak peaks on what bonus material there will be. soon they will also launch a commercial promoting the mega set.its also true that if your going to the SDCC2012, shout factory will be there selling an EXCLUSIVE Mighty Morphin complete 3 year set. this is the only place you can get that set alone from the mega set. so if you only want the first three years NOW, go to SDCC 2012, the set comes with a 2 disc dvd bonus feature set.all in all, if you just want to relive your mmpr days, please start by preordering this season 1 volume 1 set here on amazon, if your a bonus features buff, go to timelife's website and order the 7 year boxset, if your able to get to SDCC and you just want the first three years on dvd, theres your chance to get it at SDCC.no matter what, please support this release! spread the word out, and enjoy!Mighty Morphin Power Rangers: Season 1, Vol.1

reviewText: When I was a kid, Power Rangers was THE show to watch. It was (and still is) just so much fun. I only got the first two megazords, as by that time, I had pretty much quit playing with toys. These dvds are great. The quality is far better than the shows ever looked on tv. Watching the episodes on a surround sound system set to All Channel Stereo mode (puts the left side audio through the 2 left side speakers and center channel, and puts the right side audio through the 2 right side speakers and center channel) gives the show a little bit more punch...especially with the bass from the subwoofer. I was surprised at how much tiny bits from the show that I remembered. It's just as much fun now as it was then. I can't wait to dig into the bonus features. I have the 40 dvd megaset with the first 7 seasons of the show. Hopefully, Shout will do another set or just season sets with the second 7 seasons.
